tasks: Document your learning in a journal
Practice UX Fundamentals through small projects
Get feedback from peers or mentors
Analyze case studies in your focus area
Apply new skills to a real project
Create a portfolio piece showcasing your work
Share your progress with the community
Review and reflect on your growth

resources.readup: As a Strategic Lead UX Designer, you have the unique opportunity to drive user-centered design across multiple products and teams. By leveraging your exceptional UI Craft & Visual Design skills (99/100) and Product Thinking & Strategy expertise (84/100), you can craft intuitive experiences that delight users and propel business success.

resources.title: 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design
resources.description: 7 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design ================================================= Jakob Nielsen ![](https://media.nngroup.com/medi...

topics.name: Applying Occam's Razor for Effective UX Decision Making
topics.summary: Developing the ability to prioritize features based on user needs will help Strategic Leads make data-driven decisions and drive business value.
practice_points: Analyze a recent project and identify 3 areas where Occam's Razor could have been applied for better UX outcomes. Document your thought process and proposed solutions.

topics.name: Conducting Usability Heuristic Audits for UI Design
topics.summary: Mastering usability heuristics will enable Strategic Leads to identify and address common UX pitfalls, leading to improved user experience and reduced redesign costs.
practice_points: Choose a publicly available website (e.g., Amazon, Google) and conduct a usability heuristic audit using the 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design. Document your findings and propose improvements.

topics.name: Developing Aesthetic-Usability Effect Strategies
topics.summary: Understanding the aesthetic-usability effect will help Strategic Leads create visually appealing and user-friendly designs that drive engagement and conversion.
practice_points: Create 3 wireframes for a hypothetical e-commerce product, incorporating Aesthetic-Usability Effect principles (e.g., color contrast, typography). Present your design decisions to a peer group or mentor.
